title: What happens if we don't charge a smartphone for a long time? - Quora

response.answer_text: It would probably work fine . Lithium-Ion batteries that are used in the smartphones these days are capable enough that they can remain in a similar state and not get totally depleted for a few months at least . So , if it is for a month or two , it should remain fine , but if it is like more than 3–4 months , then I can’t say for sure , the battery probably dies since it had no charge for so long , or maybe it survives because it could keep the charge inside it going for long enough , this needs to be answered by a battery expert . My personal experience is that when I had my board exams a few years back , I didn’t use my smartphone a lot and for general purposes used a keypad based feature phone for day to day usage , so it could be easily a month or two before I actually charged the device and powered it on , hence I can confirm it for that much of a time period that it still worked with no hassle . Hope this helps …..

The smartphone battery will drain slowly and eventually become depleted of any charge. But that doesn't damage the battery in any way if its for a short duration. A lithium ion battery will deplete at a certain rate even if its not being used. But rate will be much slower than the case when you are constantly recharging the battery.

Most of the phones nowadays use lithium-ion batteries. Modern lithium-ion batteries are designed to withstand a certain number of "cycles" - a full drain of the battery. A cycle is equivalent to a battery fully draining, but this doesn't all have to be from one charge. So, the condition of the phones battery will depend upon the time period it has been used for.
